lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/exception/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.exception()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
Luna is your nature-themed desktop app that helps you complete your tasks in the ~~most extra~~ prettiest way possible üåª
‚ú® Take a sneak peek at Luna's GUI ‚ú®
2. Navigate to the directory containing the `jar` file in terminal
4. Give Luna commands to complete your tasks!
5. Say `bye` to Luna to exit and save your tasks for next time üí´
**‚ö°Ô∏è Please only use `bye` to exit Luna instead of closing the window,
or Luna won't be able to save your tasks ‚ö°Ô∏è**
Tell Luna your command in the format:
Create a new `deadline` task with a date to complete the task by.
Tell Luna your command in the format:
Create a new `event` with its occurrence date.
Tell Luna your command in the format:
Tell Luna your command in the format:
Update the status of a specific task in your list as completed.
Tell Luna your command in the format:
Update the status of a specific task in your list as uncompleted.
Tell Luna your command in the format:
Search for specific tasks in your list by a keyword (partial match supported).
Tell Luna your command in the format:
‚òÅÔ∏è Here are the tasks Luna has found! ‚òÅÔ∏è
**‚ö°Ô∏è Please only use this command to exit Luna instead of closing the window,
or Luna will not be able to save your tasks to storage! ‚ö°Ô∏è**
Tell Luna your command in the format:
